intro: Hieracium aurulentum, commonly known as the golden hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the daisy family (Asteraceae). It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer and early autumn. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. It has basal leaves that are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Hieracium aurulentum is often found in temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia.
